title: Gravitational waves in the presence of a dynamical four-form

title_detail.value: Gravitational waves in the presence of a dynamical four-form

summary:
Propagation of weak gravitational waves, when a dynamical four-form is
around, has been investigated. Exact, self-consistent solutions corresponding
to plane, monochromatic gravitational waves have been studied.

summary_detail.value:
Propagation of weak gravitational waves, when a dynamical four-form is
around, has been investigated. Exact, self-consistent solutions corresponding
to plane, monochromatic gravitational waves have been studied.

author: Patrick Das Gupta
arxiv_comment:
Based on the paper presented in the ICGC - 2011, held at Goa during
  December 14 - 19, 2011
fulltext:
Gravitational waves in the presence of a dynamical four-form
Patrick Das Gupta∗
Department of Physics and Astrophysics,
University of Delhi, Delhi - 110 007 (India)

arXiv:1203.5780v1 [gr-qc] 26 Mar 2012

(Dated: July 4, 2018)

Abstract
Propagation of weak gravitational waves, when a dynamical four-form is around, has been investigated. Exact, self-consistent solutions corresponding to plane, monochromatic gravitational
waves have been studied.

1

 INTRODUCTION

There are strong observational evidence in support of an accelerating universe. A small
but positive cosmological constant or some dark energy could be responsible for the accelerated expansion [1,2 and references therein]. Is there a geometrical origin to the dark energy?
In special relativity, ημν and ǫμνρσ are both invariant under proper Lorentz transformations.
Space-time geometry represented by gμν (that becomes ημν in a local inertial frame) is dynamical in general relativity (GR). What about ǫμνρσ in GR? Taking this as a cue, we extend
GR by considering a dynamical four-form w̃ [3],
w̃ =

volume-forms [4,5 and references therein]. Our approach however is different, stressing on
its association with Chern-Simons extension and dark energy [3,6]. We study the action S,

For a smooth FRW universe, the Chern-Simons extension has no effect since the Cotton
tensor vanishes identically. But inhomogeinity and anisotropy resulting from gravitational
collapse of cold dark matter would result in a non-vanishing ∗RR on smaller length scales,
which would act as a source of the dynamical four-form due to eq.(4). This can lead to a
late time accelerated expansion of the universe if A and B have suitable values [3]. If B < 0,

one can interpret ± ψ to be a quintessence field with a mass μ = −B
4A
extension to electrodynamics follows naturally from the dynamical four-form. Its effect on
magnetohydrodynamics equations in the context of Cowling's theorem and pulsars has been
examined [7].

PROPAGATION OF GRAVITATIONAL WAVES

In this section, we study the effect of the four-form on gravitational waves (GWs) by
assuming that, except for a weak GW and ψ, there is no other matter present. Adopting a
TT-gauge for the plane GW travelling along the x-axis,
h⊕ ≡ h22 (t, x) = −h33 (t, x)

h⊗ ≡ h23 (t, x) = h32 (t, x)

we express S of eq.(2), using gμν = ημν + hμν and retaining only upto quadratic terms in h⊕
and h⊗ for the gravitational part of the action [6,8],

superposed wave modes is non-trivial.

5

 SUMMARY

Gravitational waves propagating in the presence of a dynamical four-form can be decoupled using circularly polarized waveforms. In this paper, we have obtained exact, selfconsistent solutions, and have shown that the phase velocity of a monochromatic gravitational wave can generically exceed the speed of light.
